profiles.name: Sanjana Gupta
profiles.about: Sanjana Gupta is a tech writer who covers topics related to animation technology, AI, and content issues for companies like Netflix, Disney, and Amazon. She also writes about the future of filmmaking.

profiles.name: Vidyashree Srinivas
profiles.about: Vidyashree Srinivas is a writer who covers AI topics, including the impact of AI on banking and the top AI initiatives by Indian state governments.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is a writer who covers a range of AI topics, including the development of AI technologies by companies like OpenAI and Chat.com, the use of generative AI in enterprise, and the role of AI in corporate training.

profiles.name: Siddharth Jindal
profiles.about: Siddharth Jindal is a writer who covers AI and gaming, including the impact of text-to-video games on traditional gaming and the potential of Google Gemini 2 to compete with OpenAI o1.

profiles.name: Vandana Nair
profiles.about: Vandana Nair is a writer who covers AI topics, including the ROI of generative AI for enterprise, the need for a quantum mission in India, and the role of Lenovo's data centres in the AI industry.

profiles.name: Tarunya S
profiles.about: Tarunya S is a writer who covers the role of Indian investors and accelerators in shaping the future of generative AI.

profiles.name: Matthias Patzak
profiles.about: Matthias Patzak is a writer who covers topics related to generative AI cost optimisation strategies.

profiles.name: Tanisha Bhattacharjee
profiles.about: Tanisha Bhattacharjee is a writer who covers the expansion of UST in India.

profiles.name: Shalini Mondal
profiles.about: Shalini Mondal is a writer who covers the sourcing of talent for various roles in India.

profiles.name: Anshul Vipat
profiles.about: Anshul Vipat is a writer who covers topics related to large language models and vector databases.

profiles.name: Pritam Bordoloi
profiles.about: Pritam Bordoloi is a writer who covers AI topics, including the potential of AI to tackle food crises and the launch of AI career finder by MATH.

profiles.name: Gopika Raj
profiles.about: Gopika Raj is a writer who covers AI topics, including the competition between Quora's Poe and Google.

profiles.name: Sagar Sharma
profiles.about: Sagar Sharma is a writer who covers topics related to AI companies stocks in India and the potential of Claude 3.5 in the AI industry.

profiles.name: Aditya Sharma
profiles.about: Aditya Sharma, aged 45, holds a Master’s degree in Computer Science and is the Head of Data Operations at a leading financial services organization. He has over 20 years of experience specializing in backend systems and cloud technologies at various financial services companies. His professional goals include leveraging AI to grow exponentially and meeting decision makers in the industry. His motivations include bringing his best to the table, while his challenges involve balancing work commitments with learning and hobbies, keeping up with industry changes, and finding a community to be inspired by and grow.

profiles.name: Jinsook Han
profiles.about: Jinsook Han has been appointed as the Chief Strategy and Corporate Development Officer at Genpact.

profiles.name: Sandeep Dutta
profiles.about: Sandeep Dutta, an Accenture veteran, has been named as the President of AWS India and South Asia.

profiles.name: Shreya Sharma
profiles.about: Shreya Sharma is a 26-year-old business analyst at a leading fintech company. She holds a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and a Diploma in Data Analytics. She has over 4 years of experience working with cloud technologies at various financial services companies. Her professional goals include leveraging AI to grow her career and networking with peers. She is motivated by the mantra 'Whatever it takes' and faces challenges in balancing work commitments with learning and keeping up with industry breakthroughs.

profiles.name: Siddharth Jindal
profiles.about: Siddharth Jindal is associated with Fractal's Vaidya.ai, a model that has been trained on a vast dataset of over 850,000 images and text entries, sourced from open-source data, data annotation, data collection, and synthetic datasets.

profiles.name: Sanjana Gupta
profiles.about: Sanjana Gupta is known for her work on the implications of Generative AI on the roles of human animators and modellers.

profiles.name: Pritam Bordoloi
profiles.about: Pritam Bordoloi is associated with Fractal's merger with Eugenie.ai, a move aimed at strengthening AI-Powered Climate Solutions.

profiles.name: Gopika Raj
profiles.about: Gopika Raj is associated with Fractal's project of building the world's first AI life coach.

profiles.name: Sukriti Gupta
profiles.about: Sukriti Gupta is associated with a project where AWS and GenAI helped Fractal Analytics reduce call handling time by up to 15%.

profiles.name: Shritama Saha
profiles.about: Shritama Saha is associated with Fractal's introduction of Kalaido, a new Indic text to image diffusion model.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is associated with several projects at Fractal, including leveraging Generative AI for insurance, transforming the fashion value chain with vision intelligence, and exploring the potential of quantum computing in healthcare and life sciences.

profiles.name: Vandana Nair
profiles.about: Vandana Nair is known for her work on AI-Powered CRM Tools for Enterprises in 2024.

profiles.name: Aditya Sharma
profiles.about: Aditya Sharma, aged 29, holds a Master’s degree in Computer Science and has over 6 years of experience specializing in backend systems and cloud technologies at various financial services companies. He currently works in data operations at a leading financial services organization. His professional goals include leveraging AI to grow exponentially and meeting decision makers in the industry. He is motivated by bringing his best to the table but faces challenges in balancing work commitments with learning and hobbies, keeping up with industry changes, and finding a community to be inspired by and grow.

profiles.name: Kimberly Powell
profiles.about: Business development manager for Healthcare at NVIDIA.

profiles.name: Jensen Huang
profiles.about: A key figure at NVIDIA, Huang believes that generative AI will be foundational in science and engineering breakthroughs in the coming years. He also sees the future in 'codesign,' a method where both hardware and software are developed together for optimal performance.

profiles.name: Bhasker Gupta & Vishal Dhupar
profiles.about: They are involved in launching the AI Forum, which is aimed at uniting developers and experts.

profiles.name: Sundara Ramalingam N
profiles.about: Head of Deep Learning practice at NVIDIA India.

profiles.name: Gopan Vijayan Nair
profiles.about: Sr. Director-Enterprise Business group, India & SAARC, NVIDIA India.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is a contributor to CXO Corner, where he writes about AI platforms and their impact on various industries. He has written about Avathon’s Industrial AI, which powers 20% of India’s petrol pumps and ensures safety at over 17,000 retail outlets across the country. He also covers AI startups and their contributions to different sectors.

profiles.name: Vandana Nair
profiles.about: Vandana Nair is a writer for CXO Corner. She has written about the need for a Quantum Mission in India and Lenovo’s ‘Custom-Fit’ Data Centres. She also covers Oracle AI's role in navigating supply chain hurdles and tackling costs. Additionally, she writes about Indian AI startup investing.

profiles.name: Sreekrishnan Venkateswaran
profiles.about: Sreekrishnan Venkateswaran is the CTO of Kyndryl, a company that is focusing on the growth of Autonomous AI.

profiles.name: Pritam Bordoloi
profiles.about: Pritam Bordoloi is a contributor to CXO Corner. He has written about how Joule is helping SAP in Spend Management and also about Salesforce Data Cloud solving the Indian Government’s Data Problem.

profiles.name: Neha Singh
profiles.about: Neha Singh is the Co-Founder and CEO of Tracxn Technology. She has shared her journey from startups to IPO.

profiles.name: Tushar Vashisht
profiles.about: Tushar Vashisht is the CEO & Co-founder of HealthifyMe. He has been interviewed by AIM.

profiles.name: Raj Verma
profiles.about: Raj Verma is the CEO of Singlestore. He has spoken about the Database Market in India.

profiles.name: Mukund Raghunath
profiles.about: Mukund Raghunath has shared his insights on entrepreneurship, data explosion, and the GenAI Revolution.

profiles.name: Oren Etzioni
profiles.about: Oren Etzioni is a Professor Emeritus of computer science at the University of Washington. He was among the first researchers to warn about the repercussions of political deepfakes. Through his non-profit, TrueMedia.org, Etzioni has made efforts to limit the damage done by deepfakes. He was the founding CEO of the Allen Institute for AI (AI2), leading the organisation from its inception in 2013 until late 2022. He has authored multiple award-winning technical papers, achieving an H-index of 100. Additionally, he serves as a technical director of the AI2 Incubator and a Venture Partner at Madrona. He has also founded several companies, including Farecast, which was acquired by Microsoft for $115 million.

profiles.name: Amita Mirajkar
profiles.about: A seasoned technology luminaire with over two decades of experience, ignited business transformation through the potent fusion of data, cloud, and AI. As VP at EXL, she orchestrates cloud-driven digital solutions for the dynamic realms of Retail and CPG. She is the co-founder and CEO of Clairvoyant India, where she spearheads a technological revolution that will reshape the business technology landscape.

profiles.name: Disha Deep
profiles.about: An associate principal at MathCo, leverages over 11 years of leadership experience spearheading multi-million-dollar projects for Fortune 500 clients. With a solid electronics & electrical engineering foundation and an MBA in business analytics, she specialises in market mix modelling, marketing analytics, and product analytics. Her groundbreaking initiatives consistently drive improvements in RoI and foster innovation, all while championing diversity and inclusion initiatives within MathCo and beyond.

profiles.name: Ritika Dusad
profiles.about: As the chief innovation officer at Nucleus Software, spearheads transformative endeavours that harmonise business strategy with cutting-edge innovation. Leveraging her profound expertise in data analytics, AI, and big data, she streamlines customer processes to facilitate data-driven consumer experiences. Fueled by a fervent dedication to market dynamics, she champions continuous innovation, fostering sustained growth.

profiles.name: Gnanapriya Chidambaranathan
profiles.about: Aka Priya, is an AVP and unit technology officer at Infosys. She boasts 31 years of extensive experience in telecom and IT and spearheads digital transformation, enterprise architecture, cloud migration, and the integration of emerging technologies, actively engaging in various industry forums. Renowned for her technical acumen and leadership in technology, she has been honoured with multiple awards for her outstanding contributions.

profiles.name: Kaveri Gopakumar
profiles.about: An accomplished B2B Marketing expert, boasts over a decade of invaluable experience within the dynamic Indian tech and startup landscape. Throughout her career, she has spearheaded growth initiatives for numerous startups while fervently advocating for increased female representation in the workforce. Globally recognised for her impactful contributions, Gopakumar stands as a beacon of innovation and empowerment in the industry.

profiles.name: Khyati Bheda
profiles.about: Boasting over 13 years of expertise in consulting and technology, is a standout in strategic planning and analytics consulting. Her leadership style is versatile, as evidenced by her significant contributions to Deloitte and Tiger Analytics, where she led the charge in advanced analytics projects while overseeing the Organisation Excellence function, showcasing her dynamic capabilities in driving impactful initiatives.

profiles.name: Latha Chembrakalam
profiles.about: As the vice president and head of Continental Automotive’s Technical Center India, Latha Chemrakalam leads a dynamic team of 6,000 engineers. Her leadership is dedicated to advancing automotive technologies, particularly in Autonomous Mobility and Safety and Vehicle Networking. With close to thirty years of expertise in the industry, she is acclaimed for her inclusive leadership approach and has garnered numerous accolades within the automotive sector.

profiles.name: Norma Dsouza
profiles.about: In her role as practice director for AI/ML at KPI Partners, harnesses her extensive expertise in AI, ML, and data science. Leading a dynamic team, she pioneers GenAI solutions, continually adapting to meet evolving client needs. Dsouza drives strategic initiatives that push the boundaries of innovation, positioning the company at the forefront of technological advancement.

profiles.name: Preetha Kumar
profiles.about: As senior director of advanced analytics at Providence India, Preetha Kumar spearheads analytics in clinical, revenue cycle, and finance domains. With a rich tapestry of 18 years in the field, she cultivates a culture of collaboration and inclusivity, guiding a dynamic team of over 65 professionals.

profiles.name: Priyadarsanie Ramasubramanian
profiles.about: Serves as the director of engineering at Tesco. She is a veteran technology leader with over 25 years of experience in charge of supply chain technology to catalyse global transformation. She has a strong retail technology track record, consistently delivering substantial savings while championing diversity and inclusion. Through her collaborative leadership style, she empowers teams to thrive, fostering a culture of growth and innovation.

profiles.name: Sandhya Chandrashekar
profiles.about: With over 15 years of experience in automotive engineering, Sandhya Chandrashekar is at the forefront of advanced technologies as the leader at Continental Automotive. She spearheads cross-functional collaboration, leveraging AI/ML to enhance high-performance computing capabilities, all while championing diversity in tech, particularly advocating for women and emphasising the importance of continuous learning for adaptation in our rapidly evolving ecosystem.

profiles.name: Sheetal Kale
profiles.about: Boasting over three decades of experience in organisational development, embraces a ‘servant leadership’ philosophy. As the managing director at DataArt, she spearheads India’s R&D operations while steering the company towards exponential business expansion. With over fifteen years of expertise in the IT sector, she demonstrates remarkable proficiency in niche selling and product marketing, cultivating a culture of innovation and fostering robust collaboration.

profiles.name: Shipra Sooden
profiles.about: The global practice head for finance analytics at Fractal Analytics, spearheads financial digital transformation initiatives for Fortune 500 companies. With almost twenty years of expertise, Sooden leads the way in crafting analytical solutions that enhance pricing strategies, boost revenue, and optimise bottom-line results across various industries.

profiles.name: Smitha Hemmigae
profiles.about: The Marketing Head at ANSR, is a seasoned marketer with over 20 years of experience. She is also a co-founder of Your Philanthropy Story and holds a position as co-trustee at Belaku Trust. Through her endeavours in marketing and philanthropy, Hemmigae demonstrates a strong dedication to driving social impact and showcasing leadership within her industry.

profiles.name: Sudha Bhat
profiles.about: An accomplished professional with over two decades of experience, specialises in designing cutting-edge customer experience (CX) AI solutions and delivering valuable analytics consulting. Renowned as a visionary, she constantly challenges conventions in CX innovation to drive meaningful results. She is currently the senior director of conversation intelligence, industry solutions and strategy at Uniphore.

profiles.name: Sukanya Santhanam
profiles.about: A seasoned professional with 25 years of experience, exemplifies outstanding engineering leadership. Serving as the director of engineering at Walmart Global Tech, she passionately champions innovation and cultivates diversity within her team. Her unwavering dedication to excellence and inclusivity establishes her as a standout leader in the industry.

profiles.name: Supriya Raman
profiles.about: With over 17 years of experience at JPMorgan Chase, Supriya Raman leads data engineering, spearheading analytics solutions and offering mentorship. As a Google Women Tech Ambassador and a member of the IEEE ICWITE Committee, she is dedicated to propelling the tech industry forward and nurturing the next generation of professionals.

profiles.name: Swetha Yalagach
profiles.about: As Insight India’s head of talent acquisition, spearheads workforce strategy and Diversity & Inclusion (D&I) initiatives. With an MBA and over 15 years of rich experience spanning Compass India Development, Microsoft, and Virtusa, she strategically shapes recruitment approaches, optimises processes, and nurtures talent acquisition expansion.

profiles.name: Tahira Shafiulla
profiles.about: As senior director at Indegene, boasts an impressive 28-year tenure in healthcare market intelligence. With her strategic prowess, she cultivates influential partnerships worldwide, driving the development of pioneering pharmaceutical analytics solutions. Demonstrating unwavering dedication to advancing healthcare, she leads the way in interpreting data to generate actionable insights.

profiles.name: Titty Thomas
profiles.about: With more than two decades of dedicated service at Unisys, Titty Thomas , senior HR manager, epitomises profound expertise in HR, with a focus on consulting, coaching, and communication. Renowned as a global leader in diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), she champions inclusivity and knowledge-sharing, leading key initiatives and serving as chair of the Global DEI Council.

profiles.name: Unnati Gajjar
profiles.about: Spearheading India marketing at Insight, brings over 15 years of extensive experience in technology marketing and partner management, gained through prominent roles at esteemed companies such as Zensar Technologies and Persistent Systems. She is a staunch advocate for women in leadership roles and actively mentors startups, playing a pivotal role in fostering transformative growth.

profiles.name: Sree Veturi
profiles.about: With over two decades of expertise, Sree Veturi emerges as a visionary leader in digital transformation, skillfully blending cloud engineering into holistic strategies. She ardently advocates for diversity and inclusion, showcasing prowess in open-source solutions and spearheading revolutionary advancements through AI innovation. Currently, she heads the cloud practice for LTIMindtree.

profiles.name: Gopika Raj
profiles.about: With a Master's degree in Journalism & Mass Communication, Gopika Raj infuses her technical writing with a distinctive flair. Intrigued by advancements in AI technology and its future prospects, her writing offers a fresh perspective in the tech domain, captivating readers along the way.

profiles.name: Amar Kaul
profiles.about: Chief Data Officer (India) at Barclays with a career spanning over two decades. His tenure at Barclays India has been transformative, focusing on regulatory compliance, data quality, and leveraging AI/ML for data analytics. Amar’s expertise in data strategy, governance, and engineering has been pivotal in creating enterprise-level data products that drive financial services forward. An IIT Roorkee alumnus with executive education from Columbia University, NY.

profiles.name: Anand K Sundaram
profiles.about: Head Retail Analytics at IDFC FIRST Bank. His journey through the analytics landscape of India’s banking sector is a narrative of perseverance, innovation, and success. Leading the Retail Data and Analytics function at IDFC First Bank, Anand has utilized his 23 years of rich experience to transform data into a powerhouse for sales and business strategy. A Chartered Accountant gold medalist and an IIM Ahmedabad alumnus.

profiles.name: Arun Santhanam
profiles.about: Vice President at Chubb with nearly two decades of experience in analytics. He has established a center of excellence that stands as a testament to operational brilliance and innovation. Arun’s leadership is marked by a steadfast commitment to leveraging analytics and AI, driving value and fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making. Recognized for his pioneering “Office of the Future” model.

profiles.name: Kiran Samudrala
profiles.about: Chief Data and Analytics Officer and Center Head at Equifax. His distinguished career in data and analytics spans over 25 years, with significant contributions at American Express, Citi, and HSBC. Now at Equifax, Kiran leads the charge in harnessing data and analytics to anticipate customer needs and drive the company’s transformation into a data-centric organization.

profiles.name: Madhurima Khandelwal
profiles.about: Managing Director for the Center of Excellence at American Express. Her tenure at American Express, from analyst to Vice President, is a testament to her unparalleled expertise in product strategy and analytics. Leading the CFR India Centre of Excellence, Madhurima’s work in AI Labs and marketing personalization algorithms has significantly enhanced American Express’s capabilities. A Masters in Economics from Delhi School of Economics.

profiles.name: Mathangi Sri Ramachandran
profiles.about: Chief Data Officer at Yubi. Her role as Chief Data Officer at Yubi is underscored by her impressive portfolio of 108 patents and authorship of influential books. Her leadership across data functions has set new benchmarks in building data solutions that drive decision-making and innovation.

profiles.name: Mohan Sushantam
profiles.about: Chief Data Officer at Vivriti Capital. His extensive journey across various data functions illustrates his versatile expertise in data engineering, risk analytics, and AI/ML leadership. At Vivriti Capital, he heads the data and product function, bringing over 15 years of experience to the forefront of financial services. An IIT Kharagpur alumnus.

profiles.name: Rajendar RB
profiles.about: Managing Director – Analytics and Information Management, Head of Citi Solutions Center, Bengaluru. His foresight in the potential of analytics has been instrumental in establishing Citi’s Analytics and Information Management unit as a leader in the financial sector. With a background that spans GE, Fidelity Investments, and HSBC, Rajendar’s nearly three decades of experience have seen him champion data-driven solutions to complex business challenges. An alumnus of Mississippi State University.

profiles.name: Shubhosree Dasgupta
profiles.about: Country Data and Analytics Officer at HSBC. Her leadership in HSBC’s data modernization efforts marks her as a key figure in India’s BFSI sector. Her initiatives in cloud migration, data science, and AI efficiencies have propelled HSBC into new realms of data-driven decision-making. With a rich background in banking and strategic consulting.

profiles.name: Shweta Singh
profiles.about: Chief Data Officer at Tata AIA Life Insurance Co. Ltd. Her dual role as a practitioner and advocate in the field of Data Science at Tata AIA Life Insurance reflects over 23 years of dedicated service to leveraging data for business outcomes. Recognized for her contributions and leadership, Shweta’s work in machine learning and AI models has garnered her multiple accolades, emphasizing her impact within the Tata group and beyond.

profiles.name: Lex Fridman
profiles.about: An AI research scientist with over 3.7 million followers. He hosts a popular podcast where he invites influential guests to discuss a broad range of AI-related topics. He discusses ML and AI on X and regularly updates followers about new podcast events.

profiles.name: Marc Andreesen
profiles.about: A well recognized Venture capitalist, software engineer, and entrepreneur with 1.4 Million followers on X. He co-founded Netscape and co-authored one of the first web browsers, Mosaic. He also helped to build the well-known venture capital company Andreessen Horowitz.

profiles.name: Kai-Fu Lee
profiles.about: With over 1.4 million followers, former CEO of Google China, he is a prominent figure in the AI world who posts on social media about the latest developments in technology. He is also a venture capitalist firm creator.

profiles.name: Andrew Ng
profiles.about: With over 1M followers on X, Andrew Ng follows the greatest new ML and AI-related initiatives that are released on Coursera and tweets about the seminars and meetings that are happening right now. He is the founder of Coursera, a frequent participant in business group meetings, and the former chairman of the Baidu AI Group. Dr. Ng is a pioneer in the fields of online training and machine learning, and his AI research has changed the lives of many people.

profiles.name: Andrej Karpath
profiles.about: With 1M followers, Andrej Karpathy works at OpenAI, having previously served as the lead developer for Tesla Autopilot’s computer vision team. His team’s ultimate goal is to develop and deploy Full Self-Driving to a rapidly growing fleet of millions of vehicles.

profiles.name: Yann LeCun
profiles.about: With 820.5K followers on X, Yann LeCun is a professor at New York University, Facebook’s Chief AI Scientist, and a logical voice in science on AI. He retweets news stories that keep you up to date on the newest developments in the field.

profiles.name: Rowan Cheung
profiles.about: Founder of the Rundown with 531.7 followers on X is a fast-growing AI weekly whose aim is to inform millions of readers on the most recent developments in AI and how technology is changing the world.

profiles.name: Kirk Borne
profiles.about: An X star with a heavenly following of 454.7K on X. Kirk spans across fields such as Astrophysics, Data Science, Machine Learning, Data Mining, and the wide realm of Space Science. He is a global speaker, consultant, researcher, Big Data and Data Science sage, blogger, and researcher.

profiles.name: Santiago
profiles.about: An applied machine learning specialist in computer science with 381K Followers on X. He has over twenty years of expertise in developing software to address challenging and occasionally fascinating situations.

profiles.name: Ethan Mollick
profiles.about: Associate Professor Ethan Mollick teaches entrepreneurship, innovation, and the implications of artificial intelligence on education and the workplace at the University of Pennsylvania’s Wharton School and have 337K Followers on X. Mollick is also in charge of Wharton Interactive, a project that uses AI and gaming to democratize education.

profiles.name: Antonio Grasso
profiles.about: The Commander of the Digital Frontier, who boasts an impressive following of 344.5K on X. He is on a mission to use the immense power of digital technologies to boost the economy as the daring director of the Stanford Digital Economic Lab.

profiles.name: Ronald van Loon
profiles.about: Has over 330.3K fans on X. He champions brainpower superiority in big data, IoT, AI, machine learning, 5G, deep learning, predictive analytics, cloud, edge, and the magical domain of data science.

profiles.name: Jim Fan
profiles.about: With 256.9K Followers on X works for NVIDIA AI as a research scientist. His research endeavours encompass foundation models, robotics, multimodal learning, policy learning, and large-scale systems to address this immense challenge.

profiles.name: Erik Brynjolfsson
profiles.about: With 211.3K followers on X, is the Stanford Digital Economic Lab director, which researches enhancing the economy with digital technologies. He is a professor at Stanford and an author of machine learning books.

profiles.name: Bojan Tunguz
profiles.about: A well-known venture capitalist and entrepreneur with 209.7K followers on X. He has a degree in physics and has experience in a variety of fields, such as technology consulting and scientific research.

profiles.name: Linus Ekenstam
profiles.about: Entrepreneur and product/experience designer Linus Ekenstam with 199.9K Followers on X resides in Barcelona, Spain. He was recently employed at Typeform, where he designed systems and added some humanity to web forms.

profiles.name: Varun Mayya
profiles.about: One of the youngest businesspeople in India to secure venture capital funding, Varun Mayya paves the way for everyone who aspires to be successful.He has 173K Followers on X. Formerly the founder of JobSpire, he is presently Avalon Labs’ CEO.

profiles.name: Gary Marcus
profiles.about: Gary Marcus with 159.5K Followers on X is an entrepreneur, academic, and cognitive scientist who specializes in AI. His contributions to the fields of AI ethics, machine learning, and cognitive science are well known.

profiles.name: Bindu Reddy
profiles.about: Abacus.AI’s CEO and co-founder is Bindu Reddy. On X, she has 146.6k followers. She was the General Manager for AI Verticals at AWS, AI, prior to founding Abacus.AI. Her company developed and introduced Amazon Personalize and Amazon Forecast, the first AI services of their sort that let businesses quickly build custom deep learning models.

profiles.name: Dr. Sally Eaves
profiles.about: She specializes in innovation, technology, and education as a professor. She has +139.4K followers on X. She manages companies that deal with AI, cloud computing, industrial IoT, and IoT. She supports environmentally friendly educational initiatives.

profiles.name: Utsav Techie
profiles.about: A youthful and passionate tech YouTuber, Utsav Techie has amassed more than 5 lakh subscribers on Youtube and 117.4K Followers on X known by his stage moniker Utsav Techie, M. A. Utsav is his true name.

profiles.name: Aravind Srinivas
profiles.about: Co-founder and CEO of Perplexity AI, a business aiming to provide the most reliable information service in the world, is Aravind Srinivas. Additionally, he is active on X where he has 115.9K followers, where he just unveiled a new Perplexity AI editing tool.

profiles.name: Logan.GPT
profiles.about: At OpenAI, Logan oversees developer relations and helps developers that use ChatGPT, the API, and DALL-E for their development with 111.6K Followers on X. Outside of OpenAI, Logan teaches Harvard University’s CSCI E-33A Extension School course as a Teaching Fellow and serves as the Lead Developer Community Advocate for the Julia programming language.

profiles.name: Pedro Domingos
profiles.about: Pedro is a prominent computer scientist, professor, and researcher specialising in machine learning and artificial intelligence with 88.2K Followers on X. Domingos is a professor at the University of Washington and is known for his contributions to the field of machine learning, particularly in areas such as data mining, knowledge representation, and computational biology.

profiles.name: Allie K. Miller
profiles.about: A leading expert on artificial intelligence, Allie Miller is both an investor and counsellor with 59.1K Followers on X. Allie used to work at Amazon (AWS) as the Global Head of Machine Learning Business Development for Startups and Venture Capital, where she gave global advice to the best machine learning researchers, entrepreneurs, and investors.

profiles.name: Vin Vashishta
profiles.about: In Applied Machine Learning, Vin is employed with 29.1K Followers on X. He has developed and launched products with $100 million+ annual revenue. He is a strategist and engineer. His current area of interest is the monetization of machine learning, which includes pricing and revenue strategies, model reliability, job definition and hiring for roles in research, architecture, and product management, as well as the production process.

profiles.name: Dr. Marcell Vollmer
profiles.about: With over 96.1K X followers, he is a digital transformation specialist and a director at BCG. He writes about global supply chains, innovation, new business models, and corporate restructuring and reorganization. Over his career, he oversaw a number of prosperous firms.

profiles.name: Vinod Sharma
profiles.about: He is a speaker, a leader in digital transformation with over 37.5K followers on X, and a fintech CTO. He is a researcher and a specialist in using big data analytics, data science, and machine learning for SMEs.

profiles.name: Pratik Desai
profiles.about: Dr. Pratik Desai has 9,290 Followers on X and he is a computer scientist and entrepreneur with expertise in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and semantic web-based data extraction. Having launched several Silicon Valley firms, he is currently focused on using his startup, Titodi, to deliver AI and ML-based technologies to India’s neglected agriculture market.

profiles.name: Mira Murati
profiles.about: Mira Murati, the CTO of OpenAI, is an Albanian engineer who moved to Canada as a teenager to study at an international school in Vancouver. She graduated from Dartmouth with a degree in mechanical engineering and later moved to San Francisco. She led the team to create path-breaking products such as ChatGPT, DALL-E and GPT-4.

profiles.name: Daniela Amodei
profiles.about: Daniela Amodei, the co-founder and president of Anthropic, stands tall in the artificial intelligence realm. She joined Stripe in 2013 when it was still a young company and quickly rose from a solo recruiter to lead recruiter, growing the team from 45 to 300 members. After leaving OpenAI, Dario and Daniela Amodei founded Anthropic in 2021, aiming to make AI safer.

profiles.name: Lisa Su
profiles.about: Dr Lisa Su stands as a trailblazing figure in the technology industry, renowned for her exceptional leadership and contributions to semiconductor innovation. Serving as the president and CEO of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), she has revitalized the company, steering it towards remarkable growth and technological advancements.

profiles.name: Julie Sweet
profiles.about: Julie Sweet conquered complex landscapes of business, leaving a trail of innovation in her wake. In September 2019, as the CEO of Accenture, she not only navigated the intricate tapestry of global business but also painted the future with strokes of transformative ideas. Julie’s multifaceted expertise extends beyond corporate realms; she served as Accenture ‘s general counsel, secretary, and chief compliance officer for five years.

profiles.name: Timnit Gebru
profiles.about: Timnit Gebru, a prominent computer scientist and ethical AI advocate, has significantly shaped the discourse on artificial intelligence. As a former co-lead of Google’s Ethical AI team, she was instrumental in highlighting the importance of responsible AI development. She co-founded the Black in AI affinity group, and as the founder of the Distributed Artificial Intelligence Research Institute (DAIR), she has been a central figure in the field of ethical AI.

profiles.name: Daphne Koller
profiles.about: Daphne Koller, an esteemed Israeli-American computer scientist, has left an indelible mark on machine learning and probabilistic models, particularly in biology and human health. Currently leading Insitro, a biotech startup merging machine learning and biology for drug discovery, Koller has played a crucial role in advancing graphical and temporal models.

profiles.name: Sandra Rivera
profiles.about: Sandra Rivera is a seasoned technology executive known for her impactful leadership in the semiconductor and technology sector. Currently, she serves as Intel’s executive vice president and chief people officer, overseeing the company’s global human resources and driving initiatives related to organisational transformation and talent development.

profiles.name: Lila Ibrahim
profiles.about: Lila Ibrahim serves as the chief operating officer at Google DeepMind, a prominent AI research firm dedicated to advancing science and benefiting humanity through solving intelligence challenges. In her role, she oversees various functions such as operations, governance and ethics, policy, communications, and people and culture.

profiles.name: Bindu Reddy
profiles.about: Bindu Reddy is the CEO and co-founder of Abacus.AI. Before starting Abacus, she was the general manager of the AI verticals at AWS. This organisation created and launched Amazon Personalise and Amazon Forecast, the first AI services that enable organisations to easily build custom deep learning models.

profiles.name: Sharon Zhou
profiles.about: Sharon Zhou, the co-founder & CEO of Lamini, is building the future of LLMs. Also a CS faculty at Stanford, Sharon’s mission is to make complex technology like generative artificial intelligence highly usable and accessible to everyone. At Stanford, she led over 50 PhD and undergraduate research groups in AI and published award-winning research at the world’s leading AI conferences.

profiles.name: Erik Brynjolfsson
profiles.about: Erik Brynjolfsson is a professor and a senior fellow at Stanford University. He is a visionary scholar and guiding star in digital economics. He has been a driving force in the study of the digital economy, emphasising the profound transformation brought about by technological advancements. He offers a more pragmatic perspective on the rise of AI and its impact on jobs.

profiles.name: Rodney Brooks
profiles.about: Rodney Brooks is a seasoned technologist who has co-founded iRobot and contributed significantly to MIT’s computer and AI labs. His expertise in robotics and AI is unparalleled. Brooks believes that the integration of robots into our lives will be a gradual, symbiotic process.

profiles.name: Yejin Choi
profiles.about: Yejin Choi is a professor of computer science at the University of Washington. She is also a 2022 recipient of the MacArthur “genius” grant. She has been doing groundbreaking research on developing common sense and ethical reasoning in AI. She believes that AI must possess the wisdom to make sensible decisions and consider the broader implications of its actions.

profiles.name: Jeff Dean
profiles.about: Jeff Dean is an American computer scientist and engineer who has long headed the AI department at Google Brain. He encourages researchers to publish academic papers actively. Dean has reminded us that the rapid development of AI is both exhilarating and worrisome, emphasising the need to balance innovation and risk mitigation.

profiles.name: Sergey Levine
profiles.about: Sergey Levine is the associate professor of electrical engineering and computer sciences and the leader of the Robotic AI & Learning (RAIL) Lab at UC Berkeley. He is an advocate of reinforcement learning. He believes that by combining data and optimisation effectively, we can inch closer to creating a space-exploring robot capable of devising solutions to unexpected problems.

profiles.name: Pieter Abbeel
profiles.about: Pieter Abbeel has had a long and upward career in robotics. He has journeyed from teaching robots to learn from humans to pioneering learning-through-trial-and-error techniques. His groundbreaking work forms the bedrock of the next generation of robotics, showcasing the potential of AI to evolve and adapt. He is currently a professor of electrical engineering and computer sciences, director of the Berkeley Robot Learning Lab, and co-director of the Berkeley AI Research Lab at the University of California.

profiles.name: Vijay Raaghavan
profiles.about: Vijay Raaghavan is the head of enterprise innovation at Fractal. He focuses on the transformation of organisations, particularly how they are moving beyond experimentation to actively invest in generative AI solutions and maximise their value.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey writes about AI in simple, explainable, and sometimes funny words. He holds keen interest in discussing AI with people building it for India, and for Bharat, while also talking a little bit about AGI.

profiles.name: Mayank Gupta
profiles.about: Mayank Gupta is the head of Middle Office Technology at DBS Tech India. He spoke at the DECODE webinar about the importance of incorporating AI into fraud-detection systems in financial institutions. He also discussed the evolution of financial transactions due to advancements in technology, AI, and payment systems.

profiles.name: Sahil Aneja
profiles.about: Sahil Aneja is the vice president and consumer insights head at HDFC Bank. He pointed out the limitations of traditional rule-based monitoring in keeping up with evolving fraud methods. He also discussed the need for a shift to AI-driven platforms for better fraud detection.

profiles.name: Vidyashree Srinivas
profiles.about: Vidyashree Srinivas is a journalist who is enthusiastic about investigative journalism. She is currently exploring how AI solves various issues. She has written articles on various topics including AI and fraud detection in banking.

profiles.name: Vijay Raaghavan
profiles.about: Vijay Raaghavan is the head of enterprise innovation at Fractal. He has discussed the importance of waiting and figuring out the need and the steps for deploying generative AI. He also stressed the importance of strategic clarity and reinvestment in GenAI.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey writes about AI in simple, explainable, and sometimes funny words. He holds keen interest in discussing AI with people building it for India, and for Bharat, while also talking a little bit about AGI.

profiles.name: Rajiv Kumar
profiles.about: Rajiv Kumar is the Vice Chairman of NITI Aayog. Last year, he stated that there was 48% unemployment among engineering graduates.

profiles.name: Jay Choi
profiles.about: Jay Choi is the CEO of Supercoder, a South Korean platform that connects skilled developers with global job opportunities. He emphasizes the company’s commitment to enhancing job quality for Indian developers and building a robust pipeline of talent ready to meet global demand.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is a writer who covers topics related to AI. He holds keen interest in discussing AI with people building it for India, and for Bharat, while also talking a little bit about AGI.

profiles.name: Vandana Nair
profiles.about: As a rare blend of engineering, MBA, and journalism degree, Vandana Nair brings a unique combination of technical know-how, business acumen, and storytelling skills to the table. Her insatiable curiosity for all things startups, businesses, and AI technologies ensures that there's always a fresh and insightful perspective to her reporting.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is mentioned multiple times in the text, indicating a significant role in the field of AI and data science. However, the text does not provide a clear about section for him.

profiles.name: Vidyashree Srinivas
profiles.about: Vidyashree Srinivas is mentioned in the text, indicating a role in the field of AI and data science. However, the text does not provide a clear about section for her.

profiles.name: Siddharth Jindal
profiles.about: Siddharth Jindal is mentioned in the text, indicating a role in the field of AI and data science. However, the text does not provide a clear about section for him.

profiles.name: Chetan Dixit
profiles.about: Chetan Dixit is a Client Partner, Cloud and Data Tech at Fractal. He has expertise in managing multimodal pipelines and vector databases at a production scale. He has discussed the essential processes, the hurdles encountered, and the strategies to optimize performance and scalability in data complexity. He has also shared insights on the challenges in setting up multimodal pipelines, vector database complexity, handling latency and bottlenecks, optimizing for resource allocation and cost efficiency, and the importance of monitoring and observability.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is a writer who specializes in AI. He has a keen interest in discussing AI with people building it for India, and for Bharat, while also talking a little bit about AGI. He has written about measuring the ROI of GenAI investments, choosing LLMs, onboarding employees, and reinvesting in Generative AI for Enterprise. He has also written about Supercoder, a platform that connects Indian developers to the world.

profiles.name: Luis Carlos Cruz Huertas
profiles.about: Luis Carlos Cruz Huertas is an executive director at DBS Bank. He shared his views on the causes of data silos, their impact and the role of cloud technology in overcoming this challenge during the DECODE webinar. He believes that data silos are an unavoidable problem waiting to happen and that they create incomplete views of business operations, hinder collaboration, and lead to inefficient decision-making.

profiles.name: Sriram Venkateswaran
profiles.about: Sriram Venkateswaran is the APAC head of data & analytics services at Google. He also participated in the DECODE webinar, discussing the limitations of data silos and the benefits of cloud technology. He explained the capabilities of cloud data warehousing solutions and how they simplify the process of consolidating data from various sources. He also discussed the scalability of cloud solutions and the importance of robust governance frameworks that ensure data security and compliance.

profiles.name: Amit Raja Naik
profiles.about: Amit Raja Naik is an editor at AIM who moderated the DECODE webinar.

profiles.name: Vidyashree Srinivas
profiles.about: Vidyashree Srinivas is a journalist who is enthusiastic about investigative journalism. She is currently exploring how AI solves for all.

profiles.name: Gaurav Sharma
profiles.about: Gaurav Sharma is a Client Partner in Financial Services at Fractal. He spoke with AIM about the shift towards open-source LLMs in financial services. Sharma emphasized the importance of data protection when deploying these models and discussed the challenges of data privacy, bias and fairness, explainability, and scalability. He also highlighted the potential of open-source models like GPT-Neo, Mistral, and Llama, and the importance of customisation in meeting specific financial regulations and requirements.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is a writer who covers topics related to AI. He has a keen interest in discussing AI with people who are building it for India. He also writes about AGI and has written about the ROI of GenAI investments and the challenges of choosing LLMs and onboarding employees.

profiles.name: Vandana Nair
profiles.about: Vandana Nair is a writer who has written about Google's digital skilling initiative, Meta's turn to robotics, the release of Llama 4, and the launch of AI chatbots by JSW MG Motor India and Google Cloud. She also reported on Healthify's capital raise.

profiles.name: Supreeth Koundinya
profiles.about: Supreeth Koundinya is a writer who has written about IBM's commitment to transparency with the Granite 3.0 LLM.

profiles.name: Shalini Mondal
profiles.about: Shalini Mondal is a writer who has covered the AI agent war between Microsoft and Salesforce.

profiles.name: Siddharth Jindal
profiles.about: Siddharth Jindal is a writer who has written about the transformative impact of Generative AI on IT services, BPO, software, and healthcare.

profiles.name: Vidyashree Srinivas
profiles.about: Vidyashree Srinivas is a writer who has written about the difficulty of fooling banks in the AI era and the importance of leveraging cloud to break data silos for seamless integration. She also wrote about an upcoming webinar on combating financial fraud in the AI era.

profiles.name: Anindya Sengupta
profiles.about: Anindya Sengupta is a Client Partner in AI Client Services at Fractal. He has contributed to the development of multimodal AI systems that can process and integrate data from multiple modalities like text, images, audio, and video. He has also worked on projects in the insurance industry using AI to assess fraudulent claims.

profiles.name: Abhijit Guha
profiles.about: Abhijit Guha is a Principal Data Scientist in AI Client Services at Fractal. He has been involved in the development of multimodal AI and has explained the mechanics of it, including the three fusion techniques commonly used. He has also highlighted the challenges and costs associated with developing and deploying multimodal AI systems.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is a writer who specializes in explaining AI in simple and sometimes humorous terms. He has a keen interest in discussing AI with people who are building it for India and Bharat. He also writes about AGI.

profiles.name: Venkatesh Mahale
profiles.about: Venkatesh Mahale is a Senior Research Manager at Technology Holdings. He spoke at Cypher 2024 about the impact of Generative AI on IT services, BPO, and Software Companies. He believes that GenAI will significantly boost employee productivity and enhance customer experiences.

profiles.name: Sriharsha KV
profiles.about: Sriharsha KV is an Associate Director at Technology Holdings. He spoke about the impact of generative AI in the IT sector at Cypher 2024. He believes that IT services today generate approximately one-and-a-half trillion dollars in revenue, a figure expected to double in the next eight to ten years. He also noted that data centre and chip companies are part of the upstream sectors, as they are responsible for creating the generative AI infrastructure.

profiles.name: Anant Kharad
profiles.about: Anant Kharad is the Vice President at TH Healthcare & Life Sciences. He spoke about the use of generative AI in the healthcare industry at Cypher 2024. He believes that GenAI can help solve the shortage of doctors and nurses in India by analysing medical records and identifying issues. He also mentioned that GenAI is playing a vital role in drug discovery and patient care strategies.

profiles.name: Siddharth Jindal
profiles.about: Siddharth Jindal is a media graduate who loves to explore tech through journalism and putting forward ideas worth pondering about in the era of artificial intelligence.

profiles.name: Mayank Gupta
profiles.about: Mayank Gupta is the head of Middle Office Technology at DBS Tech India. He has 25 years of international experience across 10 countries, driving technological transformation, innovation, and software development across sectors such as legal, risk, and finance. He has a notable history at DBS Bank, Accenture, Wipro, and Oracle.

profiles.name: Sahil Aneja
profiles.about: Sahil Aneja is the Vice President, Vertical Head – Consumer Insights at HDFC Bank. He is a technology-driven operations expert, currently working with HDFC Bank. He specialises in leveraging AI and analytics to solve business problems. Prior to this, he led initiatives in business operations, technology development, and customer analytics at Cellexa, as well as product development and delivery at Reliance Jio Infocomm.

profiles.name: Vidyashree Srinivas
profiles.about: Vidyashree Srinivas is enthusiastic about investigative journalism. She is currently exploring how AI solves for all.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is a journalist who writes about software development, AI, and generative AI. He has written about India's emergence as a global software development hub and the rise of generative AI and its adoption.

profiles.name: Anant Saxena
profiles.about: Anant Saxena is the Director at AIM Research. He recognized the need for a centralized platform that brings transparency and accessibility to the AI startup ecosystem in the USA. His goal is to empower stakeholders with the information they need to drive innovation, investment, and collaboration in this critical field.

profiles.name: Madhu Bangarappa
profiles.about: Madhu Bangarappa is the Minister for Primary & Secondary Education. He inaugurated the second edition of Shell India's flagship event, Changemakers of Tomorrow 2024. He highlighted the significance of fostering talent and commended Shell's commitment to nurturing talent.

profiles.name: Gaurav Gupta
profiles.about: Gaurav Gupta is the Additional Chief Secretary, Energy and Water Resources, Government of Karnataka. He also inaugurated the Changemakers of Tomorrow 2024 event. He emphasized Bengaluru's importance as a technological hub and praised Shell for creating a dynamic ecosystem poised to accelerate India's transition to a low-carbon economy.

profiles.name: Mansi Madan Tripathy
profiles.about: Mansi Madan Tripathy is the Chairperson of Shell Group of Companies in India. She emphasized the importance of India's youth in leading the energy transition and spotlighted the extraordinary potential and ingenuity of the next generation.

profiles.name: Kamal Bali
profiles.about: Kamal Bali is the President and MD of Volvo Group India. He participated in a panel discussion at the Changemakers of Tomorrow event, speaking on expanding energy choices and the critical role of collaboration in India's low-carbon future.

profiles.name: Vijay Nirani
profiles.about: Vijay Nirani is the Managing Director of Nirani Group and TruAlt Energy. He also participated in the panel discussion at the Changemakers of Tomorrow event.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is a writer who covers AI in simple, explainable, and sometimes funny words. He holds keen interest in discussing AI with people building it for India, and for Bharat, while also talking a little bit about AGI.

profiles.name: Viswanathan Anand
profiles.about: Former Five-time World Chess Champion.

profiles.name: Prince Paulraj
profiles.about: Head of Chief Data Office at AT&T, India.

profiles.name: Rajat Pandit
profiles.about: Head of Customer Engineering – Digital Natives and Startups at Google.

profiles.name: Jaspreet Bindra
profiles.about: Founder and MD of Tech Whisperer Ltd.

profiles.name: Het Patel
profiles.about: IBM employee who attended the Machine Learning Summit 2023 in Bangalore.

profiles.name: Arijit Gayen
profiles.about: Employee at iMerit who attended the Machine Learning Summit 2023 in Bangalore.

profiles.name: Kirthik A
profiles.about: Employee at KGiSL who attended the Machine Learning Summit 2023 in Bangalore.

profiles.name: Bhasker Gupta
profiles.about: A techie turned media entrepreneur. Bhasker started AIM in 2012, out of a desire to speak about emerging technologies and their commercial, social and cultural impact. Earlier, Bhasker worked as Vice President at Goldman Sachs. He is a B.Tech from the Indian Institute of Technology, Varanasi and an MBA from the Indian Institute of Management, Lucknow.

profiles.name: Arvind Mathur
profiles.about: Arvind joined AWS as an Enterprise Strategist in February 2024, aiming to help customers leverage his expertise in driving change across diverse industries. With 27 years in enterprise technology, he previously served as CIO at Kellogg's, Prudential Assurance, and Procter & Gamble, spearheading transformations in data-driven decision-making, customer engagement, and cybersecurity. Arvind excels in aligning vision, fostering partnerships, and building innovative organizational capabilities. An active member of the CIO/CTO community, he was recognized in the World CIO 200 awards in 2019 and 2023 and as a Top 100 Fintech Influencer in 2019. Arvind holds an MBA in Finance and resides in Singapore.

profiles.name: Sudip Chakraborty
profiles.about: Sudip Chakraborty is a Principal and Head of AI and Gen AI at Axtria. He advises pharmaceutical clients on leveraging AI and GenAI to improve business outcomes. His expertise lies in developing an AI/GenAI strategy and roadmaps, assembling and coaching high-performing teams, building AI/GenAI and MLOps/LLMOps capabilities, and driving adoption and monetisation.

profiles.name: Usha Rengaraju
profiles.about: Usha Rengaraju is an AI consultant, Corporate trainer & Influencer who participated in the DevPalooza 4.0 conference. She led a session on 'Building GenAI applications using NVIDIA’s NIM' and introduced RAG and GraphRAG as solutions to hallucinations in LLMs.

profiles.name: Suvojit Hore
profiles.about: Suvojit Hore is a Senior AI Engineer at EXL. He participated in the DevPalooza 4.0 conference and explained how AI twins can replicate speech patterns and behaviour. He also detailed the architecture for creating AI twins.

profiles.name: Shreyans Dhankhar
profiles.about: Shreyans Dhankhar is a Senior Solutions Architect at NVIDIA. He participated in the DevPalooza 4.0 conference and compared the costs of on-premise LLM deployment with third-party services like OpenAI. He also highlighted NVIDIA’s range of open-source SDKs.

profiles.name: Kavita Aroor
profiles.about: Kavita Aroor is the Head Developer and Startup Marketing for South Asia at NVIDIA. She spoke at the DevPalooza 4.0 conference, highlighting the NVIDIA developer ecosystem and its range of tools for building generative AI applications.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey writes about AI in simple, explainable, and sometimes funny words. He holds keen interest in discussing AI with people building it for India, and for Bharat, while also talking a little bit about AGI.

profiles.name: Brian Herbert
profiles.about: Brian Herbert is an author known for his quote 'The capacity to learn is a gift; the ability to learn is a skill; the willingness to learn is a choice.'

profiles.name: Phil Le-Brun
profiles.about: Phil joined AWS as an Enterprise Strategist and Evangelist in September 2019. He shares insights from his 25-year career at McDonald's Corporation, where he was instrumental in the company's cloud journey, helping achieve the CEO's goal of saving $500 million while accelerating digital transformation. Today, he helps enterprises navigate cloud strategies by emphasizing the importance of culture and change management. Phil is passionate about fostering innovation and continues to explore interests in electronics, programming, and data science, embodying his commitment to lifelong learning.

profiles.name: Pritam Bordoloi
profiles.about: Pritam Bordoloi is a writer who has authored articles on topics such as AWS’ Generative AI Strategy and AWS’ Love for Startups in Tier 2 & Tier 3 Cities.

profiles.name: Victor Dey
profiles.about: Victor Dey is a writer who has written about AWS' various initiatives, including their scholarship program for AI and ML courses, the release of their open source high-performance Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler, and the announcement of their service for enterprises to deploy and scale private 5G networks.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit Pandey is a writer who has written about topics such as the rise of generative AI and its adoption, and the transformative impact of generative AI on IT services, BPO, software, and healthcare.

profiles.name: Vandana Nair
profiles.about: Vandana Nair is a writer who has written about MachineHack's 2nd Edition of The Great Indian Hiring Hackathon 2024.

profiles.name: Vidyashree Srinivas
profiles.about: Vidyashree Srinivas is a writer who has written about topics such as leveraging cloud to break data silos for seamless integration and combating financial fraud in the AI era.

profiles.name: Siddharth Jindal
profiles.about: Siddharth Jindal is a writer who has written about the transformative impact of generative AI on IT services, BPO, software, and healthcare.

profiles.name: Sanjana Gupta
profiles.about: An information designer who loves to learn about and try new developments in the field of tech and AI. She likes to spend her spare time reading and exploring absurdism in literature.

profiles.name: Martin Nebelong
profiles.about: A 3D artist exploring VR and AI. He uses 3D models, generated from an image, as a ‘driver’ for AI animation and predicts more 3D tools that support these types of workflows in the near future.

profiles.name: Javi Lopez
profiles.about: The co-founder of Magnific AI. He recently posted about a tool that can transform surfaces to 3D in real time, using a mix of Open Source models.

profiles.name: Tejas Kulkarni
profiles.about: A former Google DeepMind scientist who co-founded Common Sense Machines (CSM). CSM focuses on infusing ‘common sense’ into AI systems, aiming to bridge the gap between artificial intelligence and human-like understanding.

profiles.name: Dominic Pereira
profiles.about: Dominic Pereira is the vice president of product management at software firm Automation Anywhere. He has cited examples of how AI agents can simplify processes in commercial banking, such as reviewing loan applications and suggesting optimal loan terms based on company-specific data.

profiles.name: Amritanshu Jain
profiles.about: Amritanshu Jain is the co-founder and CEO of Simplismart, a Bengaluru-based startup that specializes in creating high-performance AI deployment tools. Jain, a former Oracle and Google engineer, leads the company in its mission to optimize performance for all model deployments. He clarified that Simplismart isn’t looking to enter the hardware race, but instead focuses on building a universal engine that’s model-agnostic, chip-agnostic, and cloud-agnostic. Jain sees companies like Together AI and Fireworks AI as providers of generic AI services, whereas Simplismart aims to provide a more comprehensive solution.

profiles.name: Devansh Ghatak
profiles.about: Devansh Ghatak is the co-founder of Simplismart, a Bengaluru-based startup that has developed the fastest inference engine in the world. Ghatak, along with his co-founder Amritanshu Jain, founded the company with the aim of providing enterprises with a more efficient way to manage their AI models. Prior to Simplismart, Ghatak worked at conversational AI firm Avaamo and Google.

profiles.name: Donald Trump
profiles.about: Republican candidate and former US President who is set to return to the White House after securing a little over 270 electoral college votes in the 2024 presidential election. He has expressed enthusiasm for and scepticism about Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology in the past. He is not a proponent of regulating AI companies and has revealed several plans to significantly change the AI ecosystem in the United States and beyond.

profiles.name: Jeff Bezos
profiles.about: Amazon founder who congratulated Donald Trump on his win and expressed optimism about the opportunities for the nation.

profiles.name: Sam Altman
profiles.about: OpenAI CEO who extended his diplomatic wishes to Trump and emphasized the importance of the US maintaining its lead in developing AI with democratic values.

profiles.name: Sundar Pichai
profiles.about: Microsoft CEO who expressed his support for Trump and commitment to working with his administration to bring the benefits of innovation to everyone.

profiles.name: Elon Musk
profiles.about: Tesla CEO who supported Trump’s campaign, reportedly spending $175 million. He is expected to be the chief beneficiary of the result amid Trump’s views against the EV market over tax credit given by the government.

profiles.name: Dan Ives
profiles.about: MD, equity research at Wedbush Securities, who commented on the potential impact of Trump's victory on the AI and tech industry.

profiles.name: Raul Brens Jr.
profiles.about: Acting senior director at GeoTech Center, Atlantic Council, who commented on the potential course of AI under the second Trump administration.

profiles.name: Kai-Fu Lee
profiles.about: Author and founder of Chinese AI startup 01.AI, who wrote a blog post explaining five influential factors in Trump’s victory.

profiles.name: Marc Andreessen
profiles.about: Co-founder of a16z, who extended his support to Donald Trump and donated $2.5 million to ‘Right for America’, a pro-Donald Trump PAC.

profiles.name: Ben Horowitz
profiles.about: Co-founder of a16z, who extended his support to Donald Trump and donated $2.5 million to ‘Right for America’, a pro-Donald Trump PAC.

profiles.name: Peter Thiel
profiles.about: Founder of PayPal and a notable VC, who expressed his support for Trump.

profiles.name: Crystal McKeller
profiles.about: Founder at Aloft VC, who expressed support for Trump's policies.

profiles.name: Debarghya Das
profiles.about: A VC at Menlo Ventures who pointed out that Trump’s last administration was not statistically favourable for legal high-skilled immigration.

profiles.name: Yann LeCun
profiles.about: Meta’s chief AI scientist who has been quite vocal in criticising Donald Trump.

profiles.name: Ilya Sutskever
profiles.about: Key figure in AI who left OpenAI to build AI tech that prioritizes safety.

profiles.name: Mohit Pandey
profiles.about: Mohit writes about AI in simple, explainable, and sometimes funny words. He holds keen interest in discussing AI with people building it for India, and for Bharat, while also talking a little bit about AGI.

profiles.name: Sam Altman
profiles.about: Sam Altman is associated with OpenAI and was involved in the acquisition of Chat.com. He announced the change via a post on X.

profiles.name: Dharmesh Shah
profiles.about: Dharmesh Shah is the co-founder and CTO of HubSpot. He purchased Chat.com for $15.5 million and later sold it to an undisclosed buyer, which was later revealed to be OpenAI.
